item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, March 16, 2025 at 12:30 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Show HN: My high school team's space probe (51 points | 6 comments)
2. Lynx is the oldest web browser still being maintained (89 points | 41 comments)
3. Show HN: Nash, I made a standalone note with single HTML file (391 points | 94 comments)
4. GPT 4.5 level for 1% of the price (137 points | 66 comments)
5. Apple's long-lost hidden recovery partition from 1994 has been found (175 points | 44 comments)
6. Lago (Open-Source Usage Based Billing)Is Hiring Sr Ruby Engineers (Latam) ( | hide)
7. Implications of Global Privacy Control (19 points | 10 comments)
8. Command A: Max performance, minimal compute – 256k context window (25 points | 5 comments)
9. Sign in as anyone: Bypassing SAML SSO authentication with parser differentials (256 points | 93 comments)
10. City simulator I made in Scratch (14 points | discuss)
11. Milk Kanban (381 points | 150 comments)
12. High-performance computing, with much less code (13 points | 2 comments)
13. Wyvern's Open Satellite Feed (174 points | 8 comments)
14. Career Advice in 2025 (211 points | 108 comments)
15. Show HN: A personal YouTube frontend based on yt-dlp (266 points | 172 comments)
16. ESP32 WiFi Superstitions (87 points | 55 comments)
17. How many artists' careers did the Beatles kill? (176 points | 160 comments)
18. Lego says it wants to start to bring video game development in-house (113 points | 60 comments)
19. More pro for the DEC Professional 380 (featuring PRO/VENIX) (29 points | 4 comments)
20. DeepSeek focuses on research over revenue (96 points | 58 comments)
21. Finding Signal in the Noise: Machine Learning and the Markets (Jane Street) (144 points | 109 comments)
22. Strengthening AI Agent Hijacking Evaluations (35 points | 11 comments)
23. Evidence that Neanderthal and Homo sapiens engaged in cultural exchange (93 points | 63 comments)
24. Implementing "Tennis for Two" using op amps (2024) (24 points | 2 comments)
25. ASK HN: How to engineer a JavaScript to Python migration? (9 points | 26 comments)
26. Mandelbrot Set Explorer (69 points | 27 comments)
27. Undergraduate Upends a 40-Year-Old Data Science Conjecture (3 points | discuss)
28. They're Close to My Body: A Hagiography of Nine Inch Nails and Robin Finck (2020) (116 points | 58 comments)
29. Sunset Geometry (2016) (97 points | 13 comments)
30. What Bikini Atoll Looks Like Today (2017) (171 points | 84 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, March 16, 2025 at 12:30 PM UTC
